Narrative: A 24-year-old man was arrested after firing multiple shots into a home located on the North Carolina State University campus. He has been charged with discharging a weapon into occupied property, discharging a firearm on educational property, and having a gun on educational property.
A 19-year-old former student unintentionally discharged a firearm inside their car while it was parked at Glades Central High School.

An 18-year-old man was killed and a Dallas Independent School District officer was grazed by a bullet fragment during a shooting at a high school basketball game. A 15-year-old boy was arrested in connection with the incident.
A 19-year-old student was unintentionally shot and killed at Bellaire High School by a 16-year-old student. The shooter has been charged with manslaughter.

A 25-year-old father unintentionally shot and wounded himself while waiting to pick up his child at Three Fires Elementary School. No one else was wounded, and the school was placed on lockdown in response.
A man and a 10-year-old boy were shot in the parking lot of North Crowley Ninth Grade Campus after a youth basketball game.
A car fired at another car outside of McAuliffe Elementary School. A 9-year-old girl, a student at the school, was wounded while on the playground.

A 6-year-old student at J.E. Hobbs Elementary School brought a gun to school. While the gun was in his coat pocket, it went off, firing into a wall. The student's parents were arrested and charged with contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

School name: Ringling College of Art and Design
Narrative: Shots were fired into a student housing building at Ringling College of Art and Design. No injuries were reported.
Three individuals entered a residence hall at Briar Cliff University and tried to force their way into a student's room. A shot was fired and struck a closet in the room. No one was wounded.
A 16-year-old male student was fatally shot outside of a basketball game at Deer Valley High School by a 15-year-old boy.
A man was shot and wounded at Hicks Elementary School. He was transported to a nearby hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A man died on the campus of the Florida Institute of Technology from what police believe was a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

A 19-year-old female student and her 20-year-old sister were fatally shot at a residence hall at Texas A&M University-Commerce. The 2-year-old son of the 20-year-old was shot and wounded, and her ex-boyfriend has been charged with murder.
A drive-by shooting spilled onto the campus of George Washington Carver Elementary School, wounding a man just off-campus and damaging the school building and a vehicle parked in the school's lot.

A 22-year-old man and his friend drove to the Louisiana Culinary Institute, intending to confront a 22-year-old man, an employee of the school, who started dating his girlfriend. Once seeing him in the school's parking lot, the man retrieved a shotgun from the vehicle that belonged to his friend and shot and wounded him. The victim was taken to a hospital, where he died of his injuries the next day. The shooter has been charged with second-degree murder and illegal use of a weapon, and his friend who provided the weapon was charged as a principal to 2nd degree murder and illegal use of a weapon.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A 17-year-old student died by suicide at Second Start Alternative High School.
Shots were fired in the parking lot of the Hotel at Kirkwood Center, which is located on the Kirkwood Community College campus. No injuries were reported.

School name: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
Narrative: A 25-year-old man who was a guest of a student at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte fired a gun inside a dormitory room. No injuries were reported. He was arrested for felony possession of a firearm on education property and felony discharging a firearm in educational student housing or dorm.
A juvenile confronted a West High School student and fired a shot on the school's campus. No one was wounded.
An 18-year-old and a 17-year-old were shot and wounded during a birthday party at Clinton College's gymnasium.
A nearby shooting led to a shot breaking through the window of a dormitory room at Marquette University.

A 16-year-old boy brandished a gun during an altercation on Antioch High School, which then fell to the ground and discharged. No one was shot. Another 16-year-old boypicked up the gun and fled. Both teens were later arrested.
A shootout in front of Cesar Chavez Community School damaged the school building just as classes were about to begin. No injuries were reported.

A 21-year-old male West Virginia University student was shot and killed in an apartment complex owned by the university. A 21-year-old man and a 20-year-old man, neither of them students, were charged with first-degree murder in connection with the incident.

A 17-year-old student at North Forney High School unintentionally discharged a firearm. No one was shot. He was arrested and charged with deadly conduct, unlawful carrying of a weapon, and unlawful carrying of a weapon in a prohibited place.
A 31-year-old student at Texarkana University wounded himself after he unintentionally discharged his firearm in a classroom. The student did not have a license to carry the gun on campus.

A 55-year-old school security officer was with a school maintenance worker in the parking lot when he unintentionally shot the maintenance worker in the eye. The security officer was not authorized to have a firearm on campus.
A 22-year-old man was shot and killed outside a dorm building on the campus of Stillman College.
A school resource officer at Pine View Elementary School unintentionally discharged his gun while in his office. No one was shot.
A man was shot and wounded while walking on the College Avenue Campus at Rutgers University.

A 19-year-old former student of Atascocita High School was shot on the school's football field. He was transported to a hospital, where he died of his injuries. Another 19-year-old former student has been charged with murder in connection with the incident.
A student was shot in the leg in a parking lot of a residence hall at Arkansas State University. Three people have been arrested in connection with the incident.
An 18-year-old was shot and wounded in the parking lot of Morton Middle School after a gun was fired during an argument.

A 21-year-old unintentionally discharged a firearm in a student housing complex after brandishing it during a verbal altercation. He has been charged with aggravated assault, use of a firearm by a restricted person, discharge of a firearm within city limits, and possession of drug paraphernalia.
Shots were fired near Garfield Elementary School, wounding an 18-year-old as well as striking part of the school.

School name: North Carolina State University at Raleigh
Narrative: A 23-year-old man fatally shot his ex-girlfriend's father on the Centennial Campus of North Carolina State University. The shooter was taken into custody and charged with murder.
A private security officer unintentionally shot himself in the leg while in the parking lot on the campus of Lenoir Community College.

A fight broke out during a pickup football game at a high school stadium. A 17-year-old fired shots that struck a car in the Halifax Middle School parking lot. He has been charged with attempted malicious wounding, reckless handling of  a firearm, discharging a weapon on school property, and underage possession of a firearm.
Gunfire struck the building of Windermere Boulevard Elementary School. No one was inside at the time.
Shots were fired into the air after a fight in the parking lot of Willow Woods Elementary School. No one was struck, and school was not in session at the time of the incident.

One student was shot and killed and another wounded during a drug deal in the parking lot of Southern Arkansas University. Three students and another man have been arrested in connection with the incident.
One person was shot and wounded on the campus of Grambling State University.
One person was shot and wounded during a fight in a university-owned apartment.
A 27-year-old man was shot and killed by a 17-year-old boy on a playground at the L.O. Donald Leadership Academy. He was transported to a hospital where he died of his injuries

A suspected road rage incident led to a man following a driver into the parking lot of West Bradford Elementary School. The man fired a shot that struck the driver's rear windshield, then fled the scene. Police are investigating the incident.

An Allen University police officer fired at a 25-year-old man that had pointed a gun at him. No one was shot. The 25-year-old has been charged with felon in possession of a firearm, carrying or displaying firearms in public buildings or adjacent area,  pointing and presenting firearms at a person, and giving false information to law enforcement.

A 24-year-old man went to Artondale Elementary School to confront a 30-year-old he suspected was stealing from a construction site at the school. A fight broke out and the 24-year-old shot and wounded the 30-year-old.

An 18-year-old student of Western Illinois University shot and wounded his roommate in a residence hall. The student has been charged with attempted first-degree murder, aggravated battery, and aggravated discharge of a firearm.
Two teenagers were arguing in the stands at a football game at Ellet High School. One of the teens then shot at the other, wounding them in the arm and as well as wounding a woman in her 40s.
A shot was fired into the air during an attempted robbery on the playground at Perry Elementary School. No one was shot.
A shot was fired at KZV Armenian School, damaging the school's sign. No one was shot. Police are investigating the incident as a hate crime.

A man discharged a gun in public, then drove away from the scene as police arrived. The man fled to Pleasant Hill Elementary School, driving through a security gate and onto campus. He then exited the vehicle with an assault rifle and multiple high-capacity magazines and attempted suicide with the firearm. He was transported to a hospital for treatment.

Three men were firing guns into the ground when some of the rounds struck the building of Central Valley High School. Police additionally found 10 empty shells in the area, including near where high school students were practicing. The men have been charged with shooting into an inhabited dwelling, willful discharge of a firearm with negligence, child endangerment, and possession of an assault weapon.

An 18-year-old male student unintentionally shot and wounded another 18-year-old male student while playing with a gun in the field house on the campus of Jean Ribault High School. The shooter has been charged with felony possession of a firearm on school property and carrying a concealed weapon.
Shots were fired at an individual on the campus of Parkview Elementary School. No one was shot.
A student was shot and wounded on the campus of Clayton State University. Four people were arrested and charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon and aggravated battery.
A series of shots struck the building of Rochester Prep Charter School. No students were present at the time, and no one inside was hurt.

A drive-by shooting incident occurred outside a residence hall at Gonzaga University. No one was shot, though one person was wounded. Police described the shooting as a “road rage incident.” The shooter was convicted of felony second-degree assault and was sentenced to more than seven years in prison.
Shots were fired on the University of Illinois campus. No one was shot. Police arrested two people in connection with the incident.

School name: Terre Haute South Vigo High School
Narrative: Shots were fired in the parking lot at Terre Haute South Vigo High School. A 23-year-old man was charged with being a felon in possession of a firearm, possession of a firearm on school property, and intimidation in connection with the incident.
A 6-year-old boy was shot and wounded during recess at Lincoln Elementary School. Investigators believe that the shooting was a result of someone firing on private property near the school.

A 25-year-old man fired a gun towards his girlfriend and her children on the campus of Winridge Elementary School. He has been charged with aggravated assault, carrying a weapon on school property, and theft of property.
A boy who was armed with a handgun was on the campus of Weatherford High School. As police approached him, he ran to a wooded area at the edge of the school and shot himself in the abdomen.
A drive-by shooting incident resulted in two shots hitting rooms in residence hall at Missouri State University. No one was shot.

A 12-year-old student shot and wounded 12-year-old classmate in the gym of Hendersonville Middle School. Police have taken the 12-year-old into custody and charged them with felony assault with a deadly weapon with intent to kill or inflict serious injury and possessing a weapon on campus or other educational property.
A 20-year-old student at the University of Alabama was shot and killed while in a campus parking lot.
A 16-year-old girl and a 20-year-old woman were shot and wounded while practicing driving in the parking lot of Southeast High School.
A student of Fort Valley State University was shot and wounded during an attempted robbery in a residence hall.
Multiple shots struck the cafeteria building of Philander Smith College. No one was shot.
A 20-year-old student of the University of Arizona was killed after being shot by someone in a car, which then fled the scene. Police are searching for suspects in the incident.

A 54-year-old woman shot and wounded her son-in-law while they were waiting to pick up a child in the parking lot of Edwards Elementary School. The woman then drove away, and is being sought by police.
Gunfire struck a window of Achievement First Amistad High School. Some students were in the building, but no one was shot.

A 19-year-old employee of Wayne Central School District brandished a knife at staff members during an altercation at Wayne Central Middle School. A sheriff's deputy serving as a school resource officer confronted the teen, and the deputy was shot in the foot during the struggle. The teen was charged with felony assault and weapon possession charges.
A shot was fired into the Bishop Hartley High School gymnasium. Students were inside at the time, but no one was shot.

A 35-year-old man attempted to enter a basketball game at George Washington Carver High School but was refused entry. A Tulane police officer, who was providing security for the game, was escorting the man out when the man shot and killed the officer. The suspect was indicted on a charge of first-degree murder.
A shooting between two cars went through the campus of Northern Illinois University. No injuries were reported.
A 15-year-old boy was shot and killed by a 15-year-old classmate during an argument. The teen is being charged as an adult with first-degree battery.

A 19-year-old unintentionally shot and killed a Kennesaw State University Student while they were in a car on campus. The 19-year-old has been charged with reckless conduct, carrying a weapon in a school safety zone, and carrying a gun without a license.
A vice president of Tennesee Tech unintentionally discharged his firearm in his office. He had previously placed the weapon on a table, and it fired when he holstered it. No one was shot.
Shots were fired on the campus of the University of Cincinnati. No injuries were reported.

Two teenage boys were shot, one fatally, in the parking lot of Four Corners Elementary School. A teenager has been charged with first-degree robbery, unlawful possession of a firearm, unlawful use of a weapon, and first-degree theft in connection with the incident.

A 15-year-old and a 17-year-old were in a fight in the lunchroom of Selma High School when the 15-year-old pulled out a gun and fired a shot. No one was shot, and the two teens were taken into custody.

Police responded to Austin-East High School, intending to arrest a student. The officers found the student in the school’s bathroom and the student’s gun went off during a struggle with the officers, but did not strike anyone. One of the officers fired at him, killing the student and wounding another officer.
A student of Alcorn State University was wounded during a shooting on campus.

A police pursuit led to a shooting at San Diego High School. A man drove onto the school's campus and fired at officers, who fired back. The man then went inside a dumpster on campus with a woman. After negotiating with the two for 11 hours, a SWAT officer fatally shot the man as he appeared to be "maneuvering a rifle" toward the woman.
An altercation led to a Radford University student firing a gun on campus. No one was shot.
An argument in the parking lot of Harker Heights High School led to shots being fired that fatally struck a 19-year-old man. Police arrested three people in connection with the shooting.
A 47-year-old man shot and killed his 38-year-old wife while they were waiting to pick up their daughter in the parking lot of Smyrna Middle School.

A 12-year-old boy fired shots into the ceiling of a hallway in Plymouth Middle School. A school resource officer apprehended the boy, and he was taken into custody. The boy had taken the gun from his father's bedroom and brought it to school.

School name: University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff
Narrative: A student was shot and wounded and a young woman was stabbed following an altercation in a parking lot at the University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff.
A 17-year-old student was fatally shot as he was leaving Urban Dove Team Charter School.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A Ware Shoals High School student fatally shot himself in the school's parking lot.

A 6th-grade student of Rigby Middle School shot and wounded two other students and a school custodian. A teacher was able to detain the student until police arrived. The student was taken into custody.
A man who was fixing a roof at Canyon del Oro High School was shot and killed when his firearm unintentionally discharged.

An argument on the campus of West Gate Elementary School led to an 18-year-old firing a shot. The 18-year-old was charged with reckless handling of a firearm, shooting a firearm in a public place, shooting a firearm on school property, and possession of a weapon on school grounds.

Two men met in a car at the school’s parking lot to conduct a gun sale, when a 21-year-old man tried to rob them. An exchange of gunfire ensued, leading to one of the three men being shot and wounded and another 21-year-old man being shot and killed. The 21-year-old attempted robber was arrested in connection to the shooting.

Two people were conducting a transaction in the parking lot of O’Rourke Elementary School. A 19-year-old man and another man attempted to rob them, leading to gunfire that wounded three of them. The 19-year-old was arrested and charged with robbery and assault.

A man and his girlfriend were on the campus of Stuart W. Cramer High School. As they began to leave, two cars blocked their exit, and a man fired shots at them, believing they were part of the Russian Mafia that was collecting a debt. The man has been charged with two counts of attempted murder.
Three teenagers were shot and killed during a shooting in a parking lot at Golden West High School.
A shooting in the parking lot of Narvie Harris Elementary School wounded three people. Two people were arrested and charged with aggravated assault.

School name: Roy Neal Shelling, Sr., Elementary School
Narrative: An altercation in the parking lot of Roy Shelling Elementary School led to shots being fired. A man was grazed in the hand during the shooting. Police arrested four men in connection with the shooting. One of the men has been charged with attempted second-degree murder.

School name: Booker T. Washington New Technology High School
Narrative: Someone fired a gun during a fight in the parking lot of Booker T. Washington High School. A 15-year-old was shot and wounded.

An argument in the parking lot of White Station High School led to a man firing shots. The shots struck a man’s car, who was parked in the lot at the time. No one was shot, but the man was injured by glass when the bullet shattered the windshield.

Police responded to a parking lot at Illinois Valley Community College after receiving a report of a suspicious vehicle parked here. While police were speaking to the man in the vehicle, he began shooting at the officers, hitting two of the police cars. The suspect then used one of the cars to flee campus and was arrested off-campus.
Someone fired a shot near the campus of Galveston College, hitting the school’s student center. No injuries were reported.
A 73-year-old man fired a gun on the campus of Khalsa Montessori Charter School. No injuries were reported, and the man was arrested in connection with the shooting.
An altercation led to one adult firing a shot at another in the parking lot of North Dallas High School. Two people were taken into custody, and no injuries were reported.
A shot broke a window at a residence hall at North Carolina Central University. A student inside was injured by broken glass.
Three people, including a student, were shot and wounded in a shooting on the campus of Alabama State University.
Shots were fired at Poteet High School after a basketball game. Two 17-year-olds were arrested in connection with the shooting.
A person fired three shots into the air while in the parking lot of Lost River Junior/Senior High School. A baseball game was being played at the school during the time. No one was shot.
A man was shot and wounded on the campus of Temple University after an argument led to gunfire.
Two students at the University of North Texas were shot and wounded during an altercation between two groups.
A gun that was in a Hopkinsville High School student's backpack went off. No one was shot.
A student's father was in the parking lot of Lower Elementary School when a gun in his vehicle discharged, striking him.
A 17-year-old boy was shot and killed during a fight in the parking lot of Eastern Hills High School.

Students of North Forest High School were leaving graduation practice when two vehicles in the school's parking lot began firing at each other. A student was struck and wounded during the shooting. An 18-year-old has been arrested in connection with the shooting.

Shots were fired in the baseball field at Holy Cross High School. Two men have been charged with breach of peace in the 2nd degree, unlawful discharge of a firearm, reckless endangerment in the first degree, weapons in a motor vehicle, illegal sale or transfer of a firearm, possession of a pistol without a permit, and possession of a high capacity magazine in connection with the incident.

An 18-year-old graduate of McCluer North High School was shot and killed on the school's campus. Another 18-year-old has been charged with first-degree murder and armed criminal action in connection with the shooting.
A fight between two softball teams playing at a Polk State College athletic facility escalated into a person firing shots from their car. No one was shot.
An 18-year-old student was shot and killed, and a 17-year-old student was shot and wounded, on the field at Underhill Sports Complex.

A 28-year-old woman confronted her ex-boyfriend who appeared to be puncturing the tires of her car inside the Medical University of South Carolina parking garage. She then fired a shot at him. She has been arrested on charges of domestic violence of a high and aggravated nature and carrying a firearm into a public building.

Two security guards at Modesto Christian School confronted a man they suspected was stealing at the school. When they confronted the man, he got into his car and nearly hit one of the guards, and the other guard shot and wounded him.
A person was shot and wounded during a robbery at Eastern Hills High School.  One of the two suspects has been arrested on charges of aggravated robbery and evading arrest.
A 31-year-old man was shot and killed on the Tyree High School basketball court.

A 17-year-old boy was shot in the arm in the Lincoln High School parking lot after another 17-year-old boy fired a gun into a crowd. He was charged with aggravated discharge of a weapon and possession of a firearm with a defaced serial number.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A Chicago police officer died by suicide in a personal vehicle in the parking lot behind Nathan Hale Elementary School.
A shooting outside of Mark Twain Elementary School wounded one person.
A group of children were playing with a firearm outside of East Linden Elementary School. A 12-year-old boy unintentionally fired the handgun and wounded a 15-year-old boy.

School name: Dr. Louis A. Cerulli School No. 34
Narrative: A 16-year-old boy was shot and killed while sitting in a parked car in the parking lot of Rochester School No. 34.
Shots were fired on the basketball court of Forest Park Elementary. No injuries were reported.
Two juvenile boys were shot at Burns Middle School. One victim was struck and wounded in the stomach, and the other victim suffered a gunshot wound on his back.

A 23-year-old man was placed on administrative leave from his teaching position at Chapel Hill Middle School. The next day, he returned after school hours, fired five gunshots, and lit a fire in the school. He is charged with first-degree arson, second-degree criminal damage to property and possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony.

A man and woman were providing a male stranger with a ride when the stranger forced them at gunpoint to drive him to different places. The female victim was struck in the leg on the south end of the OSU-OKC campus after the male victim fled from the car.

A fight between four men in a car parked in the Houston Community College Northline parking lot  escalated into a person firing shots from within the car. A victim was struck in the chest. A suspect has been taken into custody.
The school went into an active shooter lockdown after a student unintentionally discharged a firearm in the bathroom before classes began for the day. No one was shot.

A 13-year-old boy shot and killed another 13-year-old boy who approached about bullying another student during lunch hour at Washington Middle School.  A school resource officer apprehended the boy, and he was taken into custody. The boy had taken the gun from his father and brought it to school.
During afternoon dismissal, shots were fired by a person in a car driving by the school. Three students were struck and injured. A suspect has been taken into custody.

Two teenagers were shot in the parking lot of Freedom High School after a football game ended. A 15-year-old boy was hit in the lower body and 14-year-old girl was grazed on the foot; both were transported to treat the non-life threatening injuries. U.S. Marshalls arrested the suspect, a 17-year-old boy, in North Carolina, who is set to be extradited to Virginia to face several charges, including malicious wounding, gun charges, robbery and assault by mob.

A bullet struck a third-story window of Edmunds Middle School. Authorities believe the shooting occurred late in the evening and it is unlikely that anyone was inside the school during the incident. As a precaution, both Edmunds Middle School and neighboring Edmunds Elementary School closed upon the morning discovery of the bullet hole.

At the conclusion of a football game between Pennsbury and Academy Park High Schools, an 18-year-old male and a 16-year-old male fired shots towards each other. One of the shots fired by the 18-year-old struck a male bystander. In response, three police officers stationed nearby fired their guns, striking and killing an 8-year-old girl and wounding the girl’s sister and two other children. The three officers were charged with a total of 12 counts each, including both voluntary and involuntary manslaughter and reckless endangerment, and were fired by the Sharon Hill Police Department. The 18-year-old pleaded guilty to illegal possession of a firearm and aggravated assault. The 16-year-old has been charged with illegal possession of a firearm, attempted murder, and aggravated assault.

An altercation broke out between four people in the East Parking Lot of Apolo High School after a football game. One person was struck in the abdomen after a firearm was unintentionally discharged. Police detained a suspect, who was later released.

School name: St Francis De Sales Cathedral School
Narrative: A 60-year-old woman was shot in the hand while waiting in her car to pick up her grandchildren from school. A 17-year-old boy attempted to enter the woman's car and take her things, and fled the scene after shooting.
A 15-year-old boy fired three shots into the parking lot of La Vergne High School at dismissal time, striking a car. Two suspects have been charged with possession of a weapon.
A female student and two other people were shot at an on-campus party in Freedom Square. The injured victims were transported to the hospital and stabilized.
A man was struck by a bullet outside of Prairie Seeds Academy in the evening. When police investigated the scene, they found bullet holes in the school building.

A brawl broke out inside of New Hanover High School that resulted in a 15-year-old boy shooting another student. The injured student was hospitalized with non-life threatening injuries. The 15-year-old boy was arrested and charged with attempted first-degree murder, possession of a weapon on school grounds, discharging a weapon on school grounds, and assault with a deadly weapon with the intent to kill or cause serious injury.

Two students were shot outside of Hammond Central High School during school dismissal; one student was shot in the arm and the other was shot in the leg. A 17-year-old boy was taken into custody by police.

A School Resource Office was alerted to the presence of two men in the school parking lot, whose car struck others in the parking lot and drove towards the officer when approached. The officer fired two shots at the men, injuring one. Both men were taken into police custody. One man was charged with possession of a gun w/altered ID mark and carrying weapons within School Safety Zones.

An 18-year-old boy was fatally shot outside of Yeshiva Toras Chaim, the religious school where he was studying, in what police believe was the end of a random string of crimes. Five men were arrested for the shooting and alleged to have committed additional burglaries and shooting a different man earlier in the night. Police do not believe that the shooters were motivated by antisemitism.
Shots were fired after a group of people broke out into a fight in the school parking lot. All persons involved fled the scene before police arrived; no one was injured.

A fight broke out between students in the school parking lot and ended with a 13-year-old boy being shot in the side and injured. The shooter fled the scene. Police arrested a 17-year-old boy suspect.

Shots were reported at the Santa Maria High School football field during an afternoon weekend football game. Police recovered a handgun upon arrival at the scene; no injuries were reported. The shooter fled the scene.

A 17-year-old was critically injured when shot by a 14-year-old boy while sitting on the front steps of Aki Kurose Middle School. The 17-year-old shot back at the 14-year-old, who fled the scene. Police found the 17-year-old on school grounds in critical condition. The 14-year-old was arrested for first-degree assault and unlawful possession of a firearm.

A man was found dead in the parking lot of Gilbert Heights Elementary School. Police arrived at the scene after receiving a call from a security guard who found the man down on the ground in the back parking lot. Early investigation indicates that the man died in a homicide.

A 15-year-old boy shot and killed a 15-year-old male student who he is said to have had a longtime feud with. The school went into a lockdown and police took the victim to the hospital, who died there from his injuries. The alleged shooter was charged with murder and is expected to be tried as an adult.

Two men were fatally shot at North Carolina Central University in a parking lot. The spectators of a nearby football game at O’Kelly-Riddick Stadium were placed on lockdown while police searched for a shooter.

Shots were fired in the parking lot during dismissal at John Harris High School. The shooter and others involved fled the scene before police arrived. Police found a shell casing on school property and the school switched the virtual classes the following day while the police investigated

School name: Tri-County Educational Center - Royal Oak Township
Narrative: Two groups of teens broke out into a fight in the parking lot. After one student pulled a knife, the shooter retrieved a handgun from a nearby house, returned to the parking lot, and fired a shot into the ground. Police arrested two students at the scene

Shots were fired and broke several windows on the second floor of Sheep-Harney Elementary School. Police found pieces of bullet fragments inside the school, on the second floor. No injuries were reported.
A fight broke out in the parking lot of Desert Oasis High School after a football game. An onlooker fired several shots into the air and fled the scene. No one was injured.

A 17-year-old male student and a 17-year-old female student were shot and injured during the school day. Students were evacuated to the tennis courts on campus. Police are actively investigating and searching for the shooter, who is believed to be known to the victims.
Law enforcement responded to reports of a man armed with a rifle and a bow at Viewmont High School. When police arrived, shots were fired, and the man was killed.
An 18-year-old man was found fatally shot in a car parked at Dougherty Comprehensive High School.

Spectators at a Beechcroft High School football game reported hearing multiple shots fired in the parking lot as the game ended. Police reported that seven shots were fired and multiple car windows were broken, but no one was injured.
Source 1: City of Columbus Division of Police

Narrative: A NYU Tandon School of Engineering sophomore was shot in the arm outside of 5 MetroTech Center on campus. NYU Campus Safety believe the suspect who fired the gunshots was part of a group of seven to eight teenagers, assumed to be between the ages of 14 and 19.

The mother of an Ohio State University student was shot in the leg outside of Drinko Hall on the campus side of High Street. Police are actively investigating two male suspects who were seen fleeing the scene.

An altercation between two non-students in the parking lot of the JSU University Inn Apartment dorms resulted in shots fired. Both individuals fled the scene before police arrived. One person was taken to the local hospital to treat a non-threatening injury that police believe to be self-inflicted

A gun was fired in the stadium parking lot as a football game ended and spectators were mostly gone. No one was injured. Previously during the game, police had broken up a fight between students at the concession stand; police are investigating if the events are related.

Multiple gunshots were fired in the parking lot of the Julius L. Chambers High School stadium at the end of a football game. No one was injured. Police searched the area and found four shell casings at the visitor gate back entrance.

A 17-year-old boy was reported to be in distress on the campus of Collinsville High School. After allegedly pointing a weapon at responding officers, police shot him. Reports say the boy’s wound is non-life-threatening.
A 19-year-old fired an AK-47-style-rifle at the Lakota Career Readiness Academy, causing damage to the building. No one was shot.
A 22-year-old man fired at a group of people in the parking lot of William Tennent High School, then fled the scene. No one was shot.
Two men engaged in a drive-by-shooting that damaged nearby homes and the building of Washington Elementary School. No one was shot.
A 28-year-old man was shot and killed on the campus of Riverdale High School.
A 17-year-old boy was shot and killed in the parking lot of the Nativity School of Harrisburg.
Shots were fired from the Liberty Elementary School soccer field, and one went through the window of a child’s bedroom. No one was shot.
Someone in a vehicle fired several rounds at Lincoln Elementary School. No one was shot.
Shots were fired at the basketball courts at Tabb Middle School. It is not known if anyone was shot during the incident.
Shots were fired in the parking lot of Rogers High School. Two people were reported wounded in the shooting.

A man was shot in the back while attending a tailgate for the Fairfield High Preparatory school homecoming football game in the school parking lot. Police believe the shots came from an area behind the stadium, near an abandoned house.
A window of St Paul the Apostle Catholic School was struck by a bullet when a fight between two vehicles resulted in gun fire. All students were in the basement at the time and no one was injured.
A teenage boy was shot in the leg at the South Portland High School upper parking lot. Investigators believe that it was an isolated, targeted attack.

A 6-year-old boy was shot in the leg during the school day when a firearm was unintentionally discharged in another student's backpack. The school was placed on lockdown until the medical helicopter arrived to airlift the victim to the hospital to treat his broken femur. The Police Chief shared that the Mississippi Bureau of Investigation is handling the case to investigate the student who brought a gun to school.

A 13-year-old boy was shot by a male classmate in the stairwell of Cummings K-8 Optional School. The suspected shooter fled the scene but was later taken into custody by police, who intend to charge him with criminal attempt first degree murder. The victim was evacuated to the hospital in critical but stable condition and is expected to survive.
Shots were fired when a fight broke out at the end of a football game in the stands of the Swainsboro High School stadium. The shooter fled the scene. No injuries were reported.
A student was shot in the leg on the Santee High School football field during afternoon classes. Police identified and arrested a juvenile suspect and an unknown number of co-conspirators.
A 18-year-old male was shot in the abdomen outside of the school building. The shooter fled the scene.

Shots were fired when a fight broke out near the ticket booth at the Essex High School football stadium. The fight continued 10 minutes later near the softball field and more shots were fired. Two deputies were injured in breaking up the fight, but no one was struck by gunfire.

A shot was fired during a large fight in the parking lot of the stadium during a middle school football game. The female shooter told police that she fired the gun to breakup the fight. No one was injured.

An 18-year-old man fired shots from a handgun in the air during a fight that took place in the school parking lot during a football game. He was arrested and charged with reckless endangerment and possession of a weapon. A 17-year-old was seen fleeing the scene with a rifle and has been charged with reckless endangerment and possession of a weapon on school property. Police identified a third teenager involved who was charged with possession of a weapon, theft, and theft of property. No one was injured.

A bullet struck a window and lodged into the wall of a dorm room at Claflin University. Police identified shell casings in the road and on the sidewalk between dorms and damage to a tree outside of the dorm.

A man was arrested after unintentionally firing a gun into the ground of the parking lot of the UW Waissman Center. No one was injured. The man was arrested on the tentative charges of possession of a firearm by a felon, two counts of endangering safety by use of a dangerous weapon, two counts of bail jumping, and third offense OWI.
A 19-year-old and an 18-year-old were shot after a football game. Police also found a car with a bullet hole in it in the parking lot.

The school Principal was shot by a male former student, who shot through the school's door and shot the Principal in the back. The employee was transported to the hospital and no students were injured. The shooter is believed to have been motivated by a grudge against the Principal and was charged with aggravated assault against a public servant and deadly conduct.

An 18-year-old male student fired a gun during a fight with another student in a classroom. Three people were injured and transported to the hospital, a 15-year-old male in critical condition, a 25-year-old male in good condition and a teenage girl in good condition. The gunman turned himself into police in the afternoon and was arrested and charged with three counts of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A student died by suicide during the school day. The student entered a classroom and fired a single shot at themself. The school went into lockdown and the student was transported to the hospital, where they died from the self-inflicted gunshot wound.

Two men were fighting near the Student Union when one man involved in the fight discharged a firearm and shot the other man. The victim was taken to a nearby hospital. Police arrested a 20 year old male suspect.
A firearm was unintentionally discharged in a student's backpack during a class. No one was hurt and the police confiscated the firearm.

A 16-year-old male was shot in the arm during a fight at the school's homecoming football game by an 18-year-old male. The victim was injured but in stable condition. The suspected shooter fled the scene and was arrested by police and faces a preliminary arrest charge of aggravated battery. The stadium was placed on lockdown and the remainder of the game was cancelled.

Shots were fired as the crowd left a pre-season football scrimmage between Campbell High School and South Cobb High School. No one was injured and the shooter fled the scene. After the shooting, threats were posted on Snapchat warning students not to come to school on Monday.

A man fired shots on the grounds of Hauppauge Middle School. When approached by a security guard, he fired another shot in the guard's direction. No one was struck. The man was arrested and charged with two counts of reckless endangerment and criminal possession of a weapon.

Four teenagers from Sandia High School are said to have walked across the street to the parking lot of Albuquerque Christ Lutheran Church and School, where students were outside for lunch. A fight broke out between students from the two schools and shots were fired. One person was injured.

A 34-year-old man fired multiple shots during a fight outside of New Town High School. No one was injured and the shooter fled the scene. Police issued a warrant for the suspected shooter with the charges listed including: two counts of attempted first-degree murder, two counts of first-degree assault, firearm use in a violent crime, two counts of disturbance of school operation and several other assault and firearm violations.

A 17-year-old male was shot and killed while leaving Lights On, a program at West Side High School that gives young people a safe space to play sports and do laundry after 6 p.m. Police have not identified or arrested any suspects.
Over 50 shots were fired during a shootout in front of Lakeview High School. A 16-year-old male was struck and killed in front of the school. No arrests have been made.

Shots were fired during an incident between two men, both of whom are not GSU students, outside of the Favrot Student Union in the early morning. One man died from his injuries and the other, a 16-year-old, was hospitalized for injuries. One of the men was arrested and charged with 2nd-degree murder, attempted 2nd-degree murder, and possessing a firearm on school property.

A person began firing multiple shots at the school from a vehicle across the street as a male security opened the school's doors as dismissal began. The security guard was struck, as well as a 14-year-old female student. The student was rushed to the hospital in critical condition, but is expected to survive.
A student brought a gun to school and fired a shot out of the window of the cafeteria. No one was injured and the shooter was taken into custody.

A female student was struck by a stray bullet while attending a sub-varsity football game. Investigators believe that the wound was the result of a stray round fired from a distance away from the stadium.
Multiple shots were fired at the school outside of school hours. Multiple cafeteria windows were broken and bullet fragments were recovered inside the school. No one was injured.

A 26-year-old man was fatally shot at the end of a flag football game on the school field. The victim was arguing with a different spectator, who pulled a gun out of his bag and shot the victim. The shooter, an 18-year-old male, was later arrested and charged with first-degree murder while armed.

Multiple shots were fired from a vehicle outside of the school and a bullet broke the window of an occupied classroom. The school was placed on an active shooter lockdown and dismissed early. No one was injured.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A 39-year-old man died by suicide in a car parked in the Eastway Elementary School parking lot. The man was wanted in connection to a Newport News, Va., homicide and does not appear to have any connections to the school.
A person in a passing vehicle fired 28 shots in the direction of a person standing outside of the school. Several bullets hit the school building, including the cafeteria windows. No one was injured.

A shooting took place during a Homecoming event at Grambling State University. One person was killed and seven were injured, with one victim being in critical condition. This was the second fatal shooting on campus in a week.

A 19-year-old shot and injured five people near the stadium exit ramp during a football game between Vigor and Williamson High Schools. Police reported that one victim's injuries are life-threatening. The suspected shooter was charged with five counts of attempted murder. Another 19-year-old and a 17-year-old who were with the shooter were also charged.
A 26-year-old man was fatally shot in a parking lot on the campus of the University of Indianapolis. No information on potential suspects has been released by the police.

After school was let out, a fight erupted among a group of teens. A 21-year-old man pulled out a gun and shot a 16-year-old boy in the back and neck. A 66-year-old man was fatally shot in the head in his car as he drove by the school. The 16-year-old boy was transported to the hospital in critical condition. Plainclothes officers on the scene arrested the alleged shooter and recovered his weapon. The shooter was charged with murder, criminal conspiracy, and attempt to commit murder. Police believe that the shooter is the older brother of a Lincoln High School student and the shooting was an escalation of an ongoing dispute between his brother and the other teens.

Shots were fired from an SVU at a targeted group of students on the northeast boundary of campus in the morning before classes began. Students shot back at the vehicle and then ran into the school.  The students were searched and police identified the firearm used in the shooting; the student was charged with Possession of a Stolen Firearm, Possession of Firearm by a Minor, and Possession of a Firearm on School Grounds. No one was injured.
Police were alerted overnight to shots fired near the school, but did not find anything upon investigation. In the morning, police were called for an injured shooting victim on the school playground.

A 28-year-old man went on a shooting spree in Rogers, AR after not being able to purchase a gun at two retailers. The man fired four shots at an Academy Sports store across the street from the retailer and then went to Rogers High School, where he fired 16 shots at the football stadium press box. Several of the windows were shattered, and police found eight bullet holes on the structure. The shooter is facing charges of a terroristic act, unlawful discharge of a firearm from a vehicle, and first-degree criminal mischief.

A 16-year-old boy fired 13 shots in the field shared between Centennial High School and Jefferson Middle School. No one was injured. The shooter was taken into police custody on September 30th on the charge of aggravated discharge of a firearm.
Shots were fired during an argument between parents after school drop off. No one was injured. The school was placed on lockdown.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A 79-year-old was found with a self inflicted gunshot wound to the chest in the school parking lot.

A police chase of a 26-year-old man ended in front of the R.J. Reynolds High School gymnasium. The suspect fired multiple shots from a semiautomatic rifle at the police car and then fired at the officers from a handgun. 3 police officers fired back and the suspect was struck. The man was charged with attempted murder of a law enforcement officer.

A 17-year-old male fired multiple shots in the parking lot and alley area of the school during a dispute with other teens. The suspect attempted to flee by car, but was stopped by police and taken into custody. He faces charges of aggravated assault, possession of a firearm by a minor, carrying a firearm without a license, possession of a weapon on school property, and four counts of reckless endangerment.

An 18-year-old male student unintentionally shot himself in the leg in the school gymnasium during the school day. The student was transported to the hospital for his injury to be treated. No one else was injured. Police and school administrators are investigating how the firearm was brought into the school past the metal detectors.

An 18-year-old male student was shot in the chest near the Montebello Complex on the South Campus of Morgan State University after a homecoming weekend event. He was transported to the hospital in stable condition and released the next day. No suspects have been identified.
A shot was fired into a Cathedral School classroom from outside. The school was briefly placed on lockdown; no one was injured.

A safe passage worker for the school called police after they witnessed two men fighting and heard gunshots fired outside of the school's main entrance after dismissal. The men fled the scene before the police arrived. No one was shot.

A fight erupted in the parking lot after a football game concluded. The fight was broken up, but a 17-year-old boy fired multiple shots at the people who he had been fighting with. No one was shot. The 17-year-old was arrested and charged with attempted murder, possession of a weapon during a violent crime, unlawful carry, and possession of a weapon on school property.

A 33-year-old man fired several shots into occupied vehicles in the parking lot of Bethesda Academy. No one was injured. Police charged the suspect with six counts of aggravated assault, third-degree cruelty to children, criminal damage to property, criminal trespass, and carrying weapons within School Safety Zones.

A woman reached into her purse at a school basketball game to find her phone and unintentionally fired her gun. No one was hurt. The woman had an enhanced concealed carry permit which allowed her to have the firearm at the event. The game was suspended and she was charged with discharging a firearm within the city limits of Madison. She was released on a $500 bond and will appear in court.

A woman was shot in her lower right leg when a gun was unintentionally discharged in a dorm room. The gun owner was booked on a charge of possession of a firearm on school property and the shooter was booked on a charge of negligent injury and possession of a firearm on school property.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A man, who was a suspect involved in a carjacking, hijacked a police car, which he drove through a fence and onto the grounds of Mesilla Valley Leadership Academy. After the car crashed onto school grounds, the man died by a self inflected gunshot wound. The school was put on lock down as a precaution; no one else was injured.
A 17-year-old boy was fatally shot outside of G.W. Carver Elementary School. The school was not in session because of Veteran's Day. Police have not identified a suspect.

Multiple shots were fired outside of Poughkeepsie High School during dismissal time. No one was injured, but multiple vehicles in the faculty parking lot were struck. Police took a 15-year-old and a 13-year-old boy into custody in connection with the shooting. The 13-year-old boy was found with a semi-automatic handgun and charged with criminal possession of a weapon.
Police received reports that multiple shots were fired on campus. A dozen shell casings were recovered near the North Hall on campus. No one was injured.

Two 17-year-old and a 16-year-old students were shot in the school parking lot during lunch time. Two students attended Hickley High School, one attended a nearby school. The victims were transported to the hospital for care. Three 16-year-old boys were arrested and charged with attempted first degree murder.

A man was shot outside of the front gate of Gallaudet University around 8:00 p.m. Police do not believe that the shooter was associated with the school. The victim was transported to the hospital for treatment of non life threatening injuries.

Two men were injured in a shooting in the parking lot during a Friday night championship football game between St. Francis and Serra high schools. Both men were transported to the hospital for non life threatening injuries. The game resumed after 30 minutes.

Several goats and chickens escaped from the Future Farmers of America organization's animal pen on campus and were shot. Police estimate that the animals were shot after students were dismissed early for Thanksgiving break.

A 16-year-old male student brought a ghost gun to school to sell a 15-year-old male classmate. The 15-year-old paid with fake money. Upon realizing it, the 16-year-old student confronted him in the restroom and was shot in the leg. The 15-year-old suspect faces charges including endangerment, aggravated assault, and weapons violations relating to bringing a weapon on campus.

An 18-year-old unintentionally shot himself in the ankle in the school stadium parking lot. The 18-year-old initially told police that the shooting took place during a robbery, but during the investigation, police determined that the 18-year-old was "engaged in horseplay" with a 13-year-old and a 16-year-old when he shot himself.

Two students who did not attend school were walking outside of the school on school grounds when a man in a car pulled over to where the students were standing. There was an exchange of gunfire between the person in the car and one of the students. No one was injured.

A 15-year-old male student fired at least 30 rounds in the high school, killing 4 students and injuring 7 others. The gun used was purchased by the shooter's father four days earlier. Police found two videos from the shooter's phone where he spoke about shooting and killing students the next day. The shooter has been charged with one count of terrorism causing death, four counts of first-degree murder, seven counts of assault with intent to murder, and 12 counts of possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony. His parents have each been charged with four counts of involuntary manslaughter.

A student was robbed at gunpoint on campus property near the archery building and track. A 21-year-old man approached the student and demanded his phone and its password. When the student did not hand it over, the shooter fired one shot into the air. The student was able to flee and was not injured. The shooter was taken into custody and faces aggravated robbery charges.

The police were called to Roberts Hall, a residence hall for first-year students, when an 18-year-old male student was reported to be armed with a knife and attacking students. When the officers approached the man, he allegedly “lunged at the police officer with the weapon" and the police officer fatally shot him. The officer was also injured in the confrontation.

A 9-year-old girl was struck by a stray bullet while on the school playground in the evening. Close to school grounds, two armed suspects approached a car where a woman and a 12-year-old boy were parked. The suspects shot the individuals in the car and one of the bullet struck the girl on the playground. She was transported to the hospital in critical condition but is expected to recover.

A teenage boy was killed in the parking lot of Menchville High School after a varsity basketball game. Witnesses reported there was an altercation at the conclusion of the game that led to the victim being fatally shot. An 18-year-old man has been arrested in connection to the incident and charged with second-degree murder, use of a firearm in a felony, and discharging a firearm on school property.

A 19-year-old man fired multiple shots in the parking lot of East River High School during dismissal. No one was injured. He was arrested at a traffic stop the next day on charges of attempted second-degree murder with a firearm and discharging a weapon on school property.

Around 11:30 a.m., multiple gunshots were fired outside of South Division High School. Student witnesses reported that a fight outside of the school resulted in multiple shots being fired into the air. No one was injured. Police reported that they know who fired the shots, but no arrests have been made.

A fight between two students over a book bag during afternoon dismissal escalated when one student fired a gunshot. While no one was injured from gunfire, one person was treated for a minor injury after the incident. The suspect was charged with possession of a firearm on school grounds.

A gunshot was fired during a basketball game between Baldwin County High School and Jones County High School. The gymnasium was evacuated; no one was injured. Police stopped a car after the game and arrested four suspects, two 15-year-olds, a 16-year-old and a 17-year-old, all for possession of marijuana and possession of a gun on a school campus.

A 21-year-old man fired multiple shots in Spartan Suites, an apartment complex on campus. No one was injured, but parts of the building were damaged by gunfire. Police arrested the man for reckless handling of a firearm and shooting into an occupied dwelling. The suspect confessed and the weapon was recovered by police.

Two teenagers were injured in a shooting that took place in the school parking lot during an evening basketball game. Police took in a different teenager for questioning, but no arrests have been made.
Shots were fired in the school parking lot during the afternoon. No one was injured. Police have identified a male student they believe was involved in the incident and are investigating.

A 19-year-old fired multiple shots in the parking lot of Blytheville High School. No one was injured, but a vehicle in the parking lot was damaged. The owner of the vehicle identified the suspect as the shooter and police believe that this shooting was in retaliation of a previous fight. The suspect is charged with a terroristic act and aggravated assault.

Garfield High School went into its "shelter in place" protocol when a teenager opened fire in the faculty parking lot.  Police found around 30 shell casings spread around the parking lot but no signs that anyone had been hit.

An 18-year-old man fatally shot one man and injured two others outside of the Humboldt High School gymnasium after an evening basketball game. A 21-year-old man was killed and an 18-year-old man was injured. A third victim was struck by gunfire and injured, as well. The suspect turned himself in to police the next day  and faces charges of first-degree murder, attempted first-degree murder with serious bodily injury, attempted first-degree murder, three counts of an armed dangerous felon, tampering with evidence and carrying a weapon/gun on school property.

Two cars were struck by gunfire in the school parking lot when individuals off-campus missed the targets they were firing at. One car was occupied, but no one was hurt. One suspect was taken into custody.
A fight broke out off of school property in which an unidentified man fired several shots at another person. A stray bullet hit the school and shattered the third floor window. No one was injured.

Police received a report of a truck vandalizing the school by driving donuts on the grass early in the morning. When the officers arrived, the suspect drove onto the softball field and into the bleachers. The suspect exited the truck, fired multiple shots at the officers, and fled on foot. No one was injured. All Canal Winchester Local Schools closed for the day as a precaution.
Three shots were fired outside of P.S. 26 just before 9:00 a.m. No one was injured. Police are searching for a man they believe to have been involved.

A 45-year-old man fired multiple shots aimed at P.S. 44 while the elementary school was being dismissed. No one was injured, but the shooter did strike an unoccupied car. The school's NYPD Youth Coordination Officers canvassed the area and found the suspect, who has been charged with criminal possession of a loaded weapon, criminal possession of a loaded weapon at a school, reckless endangerment, criminal possession of a firearm, and criminal mischief.

A woman fired two shots from her car outside of the school before driving away. No one was injured. Police found a handgun, 17 rounds of ammunition and one spent bullet casing inside the car. The suspect is facing charges of reckless endangerment, felon in possession of a firearm, two counts of unauthorized use of a weapon, two counts of unlawful discharge of a firearm, and unlawful possession of a loaded firearm.

A 17-year-old boy and a 17-year-old girl, both students, were shot around 1:00 p.m. while sitting in a car in the school parking lot. The school went into lockdown. Three suspects-- all juvenile males-- fled the parking lot in a vehicle and were taken into custody later that day. Police discovered two handguns in the suspects' car.

A 25-year-old man was fatally shot near a playground on the grounds of School No. 17. Police apprehended and charged a 21-year-old male suspect with second-degree murder and second-degree criminal possession of a weapon.
A gun was fired in a Chowan University dorm room around 6:00 p.m.. No one was injured. A refrigerator was struck with a bullet. Campus police have launched an investigation into the incident.

A fight near the concessions stand in the lobby of the Catawba College gymnasium where the Sam Moir Christmas Basketball Tournament was taking place escalated and multiple shots were fired. Two bystanders were shot. A 14-year-old boy was shot in the forearm and a 13-year-old boy was struck in the right leg. The two suspects, both minors, fled the scene, but were located by police. Both suspects were charged with two counts of attempted murder. The remainder of the tournament was cancelled.
At least one shot was fired in the Edward A. Upthegrove Elementary School gymnasium. No injuries were reported. The shooter fled the scene.
A 33-year-old man in the elementary school parking lot called 911 and reported that he was suicidal. When the police arrived, the man pointed a gun at the officer. The officer fatally shot the man.

School name: Bishop Noll Institute/Catholic Dioece Of Gary
Narrative: A 43-year-old woman was fatally shot in the stomach inside of her vehicle in the school parking lot. The woman's 38-year-old boyfriend was charged with murder and unlawful possession of a firearm by a serious violent felon.

A fight between multiple women took place in the school parking lot around 7:00 p.m. A group of men arrived to watch. During the fight, a vehicle approached the school with a man leaning outside of the window. A man in the crowd shot a round at the person leaning out of the car, but struck a 19-year-old male bystander instead.

An argument between two groups of people around 11:00 p.m. in the school gymnasium escalated to gunfire. One person was shot in the leg and transported to the hospital. Several individuals fled the scene before police arrived.

School name: Sarah Moore Greene Magnet Technology Academy
Narrative: A woman drove into the parking lot of the elementary school when she realized a car was following her. The car followed her to the parking lot and the driver fired three shots in the direction of her car before fleeing the scene. No one was injured. The woman drove directly to the police precinct and the school went on lockdown for two hours.

After an 18-year-old man made a TikTok with a girl, her former boyfriend challenged the man to a fight in the high school parking lot. The men fought for 3-5 minutes in the parking lot before going back to their cars. A 20-year-old man and another 18-year-old men who witnessed the fight fired multiple shots. The 18-year-old man who made the original TikTok was fatally shot in the head and another man was injured after a bullet grazed the side of his head. The suspected shooters were charged with murder, attempted murder, and battery by means of a deadly weapon.

A 19-year-old man was sitting with his girlfriend in a parked car in the school parking lot. Three people approached the vehicle, tried to steal the car, and fatally shot the man in the torso. The woman was not injured. Two 16-year-old suspects were arrested and charged with homicide, attempted homicide, and conspiracy.

Multiple shots were fired around 8:30 p.m. in the parking lot of the high school gymnasium as a basketball game was being played. All players and spectators went into lockdown; no one was injured. Police found shell casings in the parking lot.

A man was fatally shot while sitting in his vehicle in the school parking lot around 11:20 p.m. A second car entered the parking lot and three individuals left the car. They opened fire on the driver's side of the man's car and fatally shot him. Surveillance footage also showed an  injured woman be carried back into the second car. The shooters fled the scene. Police believe that the woman was the same woman who was found dead later in the night a few blocks away.

A campus police officer noticed a 28-year-old man waving a handgun in the air on campus around 11:45 a.m.  The officer stopped the individual and the individual fired the gun at the police officer. The officer fired back; the individual was struck and transported to the hospital. He has been charged with attempted murder of a police officer, aggravated discharge of a weapon, and aggravated unauthorized use of a weapon. The officer has been placed on administrative leave pending an investigation.

A 34-year-old man was shot multiple times outside of Weitz Hall around 2:00 p.m. when an argument between him and a 53-year-old man escalated. The 53-year-old fled the area and was taken into custody at JFK International Airport in New York where he was attempting to flee the country. The suspected shooter was charged with attempted homicide.
Two shots were fired during an altercation around 11:00 p.m. in a dorm room. One individual was injured.

Two vehicles got into an accident near the campus of Georgia Southern University. The victim of the crash was being followed by the other car involved and drove onto a road leading to campus and  Kennedy Hall. The assailant fired multiple shots at the victims car. The victim suffered minor injuries during the incident but was not directly hit by gunfire. The university confirmed that neither individual is associated with the university.
A man fired multiple shots at Parkland High School during afternoon dismissal. Students returned to the building and the school went into lockdown. No one was injured.

A 15-year-old boy was shot in the shin at the entrance to the school building during dismissal time. The school went into lockdown until the scene was cleared. The school confirmed that the 15-year-old victim is a student at the school.

School name: Southern University and A & M College
Narrative: Two people were injured in a shooting between 2:00 and 2:30 a.m. in a residential area of the Southern University campus. A university representative confirmed that neither victim was a student at the university.
An individual unaffiliated with the university entered the Village South dormitories and fired multiple shots. No one was injured. The campus was on lockdown until 2:00 a.m.
Two men, who were both unaffiliated with the university, got into an argument and shot each other outside of the Falkcrest Apartments Residence Hall. Both men were injured.

School name: North Carolina State University at Raleigh
Narrative: A man approached a car that was parked in the parking lot of the Avent Ferry Complex, an undergraduate dorm, with multiple students inside and attempted to steal the vehicle. The students began to drive away and the suspect fired multiple shots at the vehicle. No one was injured and no property was stolen.

An 18-year-old male student was shot three times by a 16-year-old male student in an academic building during the school day. Police reported that the shooting is the result of a dispute between the victim and the accused shooter. The school was locked down for two hours. The accused shooter was arrested and is facing one count of attempted homicide, one count of possession of a firearm on campus, one count of firing a weapon and one count of disturbing the peace while interfering with school administration functions.

An animal control officer followed a pair of dogs onto the property of Perth Bible Church and Christian Academy. When the dogs became aggressive, the officer shot and wounded one of them with his personal gun. He has been charged with reckless endangerment and illegal discharge of a firearm.
A 21-year-old man was shot and killed while in a vehicle in the parking lot of Highland Elementary School.
An off-campus shooting led to bullets striking the building of East High School. Three teenagers, students at the school, were wounded off-campus.

A police officer and a campus safety officer were called to campus after staff reported a suspicious man, a 27-year-old, in an off-limits area of campus. The officers approached the man. The man fired multiple gunshots and fatally shot both officers. The alleged shooter fled the scene and was taken into police custody after a 30-minute search. Police reported that the alleged shooter obtained a gunshot injury, but it is not clear if it was self-inflicted. He has been charged with aggravated murder of a police officer, first-degree murder, aggravated murder of multiple persons within 3 years, aggravated murder of multiple persons, and possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony.

A 17-year-old boy assembled a ghost gun with a friend and brought the firearm to school, citing he knew that there would be a conflict. He went into the boys bathroom to meet a 15-year-old boy, whom he reportedly was in an ongoing dispute with. The suspect aimed the gun at the 15-year-boy's head. The victim pushed the gun away and was shot in the pelvis. The victim was found in the bathroom during a security sweep between classes. The suspect has been charged as an adult with attempted second-degree murder, first-degree assault, use of a firearm in the commission of a felony, possession of a dangerous weapon on school property and possession of a firearm by a minor.

A 19-year-old man was fatally shot in the front parking lot of Beloit Memorial High School after a Saturday night basketball game. The man is a former student at the school. The School Resource Officer working at the basketball game heard gunshots and found evidence of a shooting in the parking lot. The shooter fled the scene and police shared that the suspect is an adult male.

Two teenagers were shot in a vehicle behind Westwood Elementary School. One victim had a gunshot wound to the abdomen and one had a gunshot wound to the finger. One of the victims, a 16-year-old boy, was pronounced dead in the hospital hours later. Police reported that shell casings from the firearm were found on school property.

Two men in their mid-20s were approached by three other men, who began shooting at them. The two men returned fire. No one was injured, but a bullet hit Benjamin E Mays Elementary School and several vehicles.

School name: Dr. Charles R. Drew Elementary School
Narrative: A large group of people were congregating in the school parking lot around 2:00 a.m. Two shots were fired and the group fled. No injuries or property damaged were reported. Police reported that they found shell casings from at least two different firearms.
A 15-year-old boy was sitting in the elementary school yard when a car drove by and shot him. The boy was struck in the right arm, thigh, and hip and transported to a nearby hospital.

A 19-year-old man was shot and wounded in the parking lot of the Central High School stadium, Deran Koligian Stadium, after a football game between Central and Bullard High Schools. Police arrested the 19-year-old suspect after he fled from the scene. The suspect is facing charges of attempted homicide and carjacking for entering someone else's vehicle and trying to get them to drive him away.

School name: Jefferson County School District - North Area Athletic Complex
Narrative: Four shots were fired by a person leaning out of a car on the far west end of the athletic complex around 8:30 p.m. during a football game. No one was injured and no property was damaged. The complex is owned by the school district and houses its athletic events.

A 16-year-old boy was shot in the leg outside of the school gym after a Friday night basketball game. Police reported they do not believe the victim was the intended target. The boy was transported to the hospital and is expected to recover.
A student unintentionally shot and injured themselves in the school parking lot during dismissal. The student was rushed to a nearby hospital. No other injuries were reported.
Shots were fired in the school parking lot around 3:30 p.m. No one was injured. Police have arrested a possible suspect.

A person was shot and injured at The Degree Housing Complex, a UNLV residence hall, around midnight. Witnesses reported the shooter fled the scene in a white vehicle. Police confirmed that neither the victim nor shooter were UNLV students.
A person fired several shots at an individual they were chasing outside of the high school after dismissal time. The bullets struck the front door of the school. No injuries were reported.

A man and woman drove to the elementary school to buy a car. When they arrived, three men approached the vehicle to rob the pair. As the individuals drove away, the woman, in the passenger seat, was shot in the shoulder and went to a nearby fire station for medical attention.

Three individuals were caught burglarizing vehicles in the school parking after the Carroll vs. Richwood basketball game. They were confronted by one of the vehicle owners, and fired two shots at the vehicle owner before fleeing the scene on foot. No one was injured.

School name: Logan County Career and Technical Center
Narrative: Two of the school's windows were shot around 8:15 a.m., prior to school beginning. No students or staff were inside the building and no one was injured.

A 16-year-old boy was shot outside of Catonsville High School shortly after students were dismissed for the day. Witnesses reported they saw a white vehicle drive into the parking lot, a person exit the car and fire three shots at the student, and drive away. The school was locked down and the student transported to the hospital.

A 14-year-old student was stabbed in the parking lot shortly after the school's dismissal time. A security officer went to assist the student and was shot in the leg. Two 17-year-old males have been arrested. The suspected shooter was arraigned on March 4th on one count of Attempted Murder in the Second Degree, one count of Criminal Possession of a Weapon in the Second Degree, and one count of Assault in the Second Degree.

Police were called to the school at 3:20 p.m. due to a report of a suspicious person in the parking lot. The man was reportedly banging on the windows of parents' cars in the parking lot and became 'assaultive' with officers when approached. After the suspect attacked an officer and attempt to take his gun, the officer fatally shot the suspect.
A fourth grade student was wounded when they unintentionally fired a gun in their classroom. The school was placed on lockdown and the student was transported to the hospital to treat their injuries.
A man was shot and injured in the parking lot of Eagle Academy. Police are investigating, but have not released any additional information.

After a report of a student in possession of a gun, an 18-year-old male student was called to the assistant principal’s office. After refusing to allow anyone to search his backpack, an SRO was called to the office. When he arrived, the student pulled out the ghost gun and fired five shots at the SRO wounding him. The SRO returned fire wounding the student and the assistant principal. The school went into lockdown. The student was charged with attempted capital murder, possession of a firearm by a felon (as he was previously convicted of an armed robbery), and two counts of criminal use of a weapon for bringing a firearm to school and refusing to surrender the weapon when confronted.
A 14-year-old boy was shot in the ankle outside of Boys and Girls High School. The student was leaving school during dismissal when the shooting occurred. No other injuries were reported.

A 15-year-old boy, a 16-year-old girl, and an 18-year-old girl were shot in a drive by shooting while walking along the northwest corner of the school's campus. The 15-year-old boy was the intended target of the attack, and he was pronounced dead after being transported to the hospital. Police identified that there were multiple shooters in multiple cars and arrested six teenagers, all of whom were charged with first-degree murder and two counts of attempted murder.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: An Assistant Principal died by firearm suicide in a locked staff bathroom. No one else was injured. School operations were suspended for the day.

Two teenagers were shot in the school's stadium parking lot during an altercation between two groups of teenagers. One, a 16-year-old, was fatally shot. The other victim, an 18-year-old, was transported to the hospital in critical conditions. Both victims were students at the school. Police have arrested a 15-year-old male suspect and charged him with second-degree murder, nine counts of first-degree assault, one count each of second-degree unlawful firearms possession, and carrying a firearm on school property.
