A 31-year-old male teacher and a 17-year-old male student were shot in the school parking lot while setting up for an evening event. Both were transported to the hospital with non-critical injuries. Two male students, one 17 and the other 16, have been charged with unlawful possession of a firearm, unlawful possession of ammunition, carrying a loaded firearm, assault and battery by means of a dangerous weapon and discharging a firearm within 500 feet of a dwelling.
A student brought a firearm to school and discharged the weapon in a bathroom. No one was injured. Two students were taken into custody.
Shots were fired during a fight between two groups of students in the student parking lot at dismissal time. No one was struck. Police are investigating the incident.
Two students were shot while sitting in class. One, an 18-year-old male student, was shot in the leg. Both students were transported to the hospital Police have arrested two male suspects.

A 20-year-old man was arrested for firing a gun on school grounds when a domestic dispute moved from a nearby house to school property. The SRO found the alleged shooter outside on school grounds wearing a ski mask and holding a rifle and a shotgun. The suspect was taken into custody and charged with discharging a firearm on school grounds and possession of a firearm on school grounds.
Shots were fired from a white Ford Escape in the student parking lot around the school's dismissal time. Witnesses reported that four males were inside the car. No one was injured.

School name: Lucy Addison Aerospace Magnet Middle School
Narrative: A male student fired a gun in a school bathroom. No one was injured. The alleged shooter was transported to a Juvenile Detention Center and charged with possession of a firearm on school grounds and discharging a firearm on school grounds.

After a fight broke out between students during school dismissal, an angry 30-year-old mother came to the school with a weapon. The parent was waving the weapon in the direction of students and school employees. An Atlanta Public Schools Officer ordered the parent to drop the weapon and, when she did not, fired a shot at her hand. The woman faces charges for obstructing a law enforcement officer with violence, disrupting public school, carrying and possession of firearm on school property, aggravated assault, cruelty to children, and contributing to delinquency of a minor.

A classroom in Thomas A. Hendricks Community School was struck by at least one bullet during a drive-by shooting. No one on school grounds was injured. However, a man was struck by a bullet while driving near the school.

A 12-year-old boy was fatally shot by a 12-year-old boy in the 700 wing of the school. The suspect fled the scene and was found under the deck of an off-campus residence. The suspect is being charged with murder, possession of a weapon during a violent crime, possession of a firearm on school property and unlawful possession of a weapon by a person under the age of 18.

School name: West Philadelphia Achievement Charter Elementary School
Narrative: An 8-year-old boy came to school with a gun in his backpack. Early in the school day, the gun was unintentionally discharged in his backpack. No one was injured.

Multiple shots were fired in a school hallway by a student under the age of 15 with a 9 mm handgun. A student was struck in the leg and injured. The alleged shooter fled the scene. A juvenile suspect later turned himself in to police.
Multiple shots were fired in a parking lot on the college's main campus. No one was injured. The college went into lockdown and cancelled classes for the remainder of the day.

A 20-year-old man was fatally shot behind the school building. Police were called to the scene around 1:00 a.m. after neighbors reported hearing shots fired. Police are investigating; no arrests have been made.
Shots were fired in a parking lot on the southern edge of campus. The school went into lockdown. No one was injured. Police detained a juvenile suspect for questioning.
Multiple shots were fired from a car in the school driveway. Three shell cases were recovered on the campus. No one was injured.
An 18-year-old male student was shot in the leg when a conflict outside of the school gym escalated. The suspect fled the scene.
A bullet hole was discovered in a third floor classroom window and a bullet was found inside of the room. No one was injured.

A 12-year-old boy was attending an afterschool program in the school's multi-purpose room and showed a firearm inside his backpack to other students. While sitting with others, the firearm unintentionally fired and struck the table and ground. No one was injured and the school was evacuated. The boy was arrested on suspicion of negligent discharge of a firearm within an occupied building and possession of a firearm on a school campus.

School name: Joe Redington Senior Jr/Sr High School
Narrative: A student discharged a firearm outside of the school building shortly after students were dismissed from school for the day. No one was injured. The student was arrested and the charges related to the incidents were forwarded to the Division of Juvenile Justice.
A student brought a firearm to school that went off on campus and sent the school into lockdown. School officials did not release where on campus the firearm discharged. No one was injured.

Police were called to the middle school outside of school hours on reports of a burglary by a 20-year-old man. School officials reported that a gun was fired when police confronted the suspect, but have not confirmed who fired the weapon or reported any injuries. The suspected man was charged with burglary.

Multiple gun shots were fired during school dismissal time beside the football field, on the southeast side of the school building, when a fight escalated. School officials said they've identified the individuals involved in the fight, but not the shooter. No one was injured.

A man opened fire on a candlelight vigil, firing four to five shots from his car. No one was injured. The suspect fled the scene. Police expect to charge him with attempted murder and 10-20 counts of reckless endangerment when he is found.

An 18-year-old man, a 16-year-old boy, and an additional minor got into a fight over a firearm that escalated and shots were fired. The incident took place on the elementary school's athletic field during a teacher workday. The two juveniles were injured. The 18-year-old was charged with armed robbery and assault with a deadly weapon. Police reported that both juveniles will be charged for the incident after being treated for their injuries.

A car entered the east parking lot at a high speed and hit one student. The CCSD police officer ordered the car to stop, and when it didn't, fired their gun at the car. Two teenagers in the car-- one a 16-year-old boy and one a juvenile-- were struck and injured by the officer's gunfire.

A 21-year-old man fired multiple shots into the air in the area between the Dining Hall and Student Union. Campus police found a spent shell casing in that area. The man was arrested the next day and police recommended charges of discharging a firearm in a school zone, discharging a firearm within 100 yards of a building devoted to human occupancy, carrying a concealed weapon, carrying a handgun where alcohol may be sold or consumed, disorderly conduct, and resisting or obstructing an officer.

A 15-year-old boy fired multiple shots from a car, aimed at students as they walked out of the school during dismissal. Police believe that this
shooting was part of a series of retaliation shootings between rival gangs and that the weapon recovered was taken an armed robbery nearby. No one was injured. The 15-year-old was arrested, as well as a 19-year-old man, who was charged with three counts of aggravated assault and one count of possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony.

A teenager was killed and two other teenagers were wounded when an argument in the education center's parking lot escalated to gunfire. An 18-year-old man and a 19-year-old man fatally shot a 15-year-old boy and injured a 17-year-old boy and a 19-year-old man in the altercation. Police discovered two handguns. Both alleged shooters were arrested and each face a murder charge without bail.

A fight broke out between two teenager girls in the school parking lot after a basketball game. A group of onlookers gathered around the fight. One of the teenagers involved in the fight called her 35-year-old uncle to the scene. He fired a gun at the ground and injured five females nearby, ages 15, 16, 17 and 20. The man turned himself into police three days later and was charged with five counts of second-degree recklessly endangering safety.
A student was shot and injured in the school parking lot around 9:30 p.m. Nearby neighbors reported that they heard 5-9 gunshots. The shooter fled the scene by foot.

A 14-year-old girl was shot and wounded at a carnival on school grounds when an argument between two groups of people escalated to gunfire. The teenage girl was struck in the abdomen and transported to the hospital.

A 12-year-old student, two women in vehicles, and a school security guard were injured when a 23-year-old male “lone-wolf sniper" fired more than 200 bullets from his apartment window, aimed at the school. The glass that encased a walkway between two campus buildings was shattered during the shooting.  When police approached the suspect's apartment, he fatally shot himself. Police found six additional firearms and 800 unused bullets in the apartment.
A student was injured when they were struck by a bullet that ricocheted off the ground in Parking Lot 14A.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A male student died from a self-inflicted gunshot during the school day. A Michigan State Trooper found the student alone in a school bathroom. He was transported to a local hospital, where he died from the gunshot.

A man was shot and killed in the school parking lot around 6:40 a.m. A 19-year-old man was charged with second-degree murder, armed criminal action and first-degree robbery. A 17-year-old man was also arrested and referred to family court.
A woman was injured in an unintentional shooting in the Quad 1 Residence Hall. The woman told police that the shooting was not intentional and she will not press charges.
A man was shot and wounded in a dorm room. Police reported that it is unclear if the shooting was self-inflicted or if the victim was shot by a different person.

A verbal argument between three men at a youth football game escalated and shots were fired. A 24-year-old man and a 33-year-old man were wounded. The third man, the 23-year-old suspected shooter, fled the scene. He eventually turned himself in to police and was charged with two counts of aggravated malicious wounding, possession of a firearm on school grounds, two counts of use of a firearm during a felony, and two counts of use of a firearm while on school grounds.
Police were called when a 34-year-old man broke into the school building. The man was fatally shot by a responding officer when the man assaulted the officer.
Two to three shots were fired when a fight broke out at the National Panhellenic Council end-of-year cookout in the Shackelford Quad on campus. No one was wounded.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A middle school male student shot and injured himself in the school cafeteria. The school went into lockdown and the student was taken to receive help. He passed away the following day.  No other injuries were reported.

Police responded to a call regarding shots being fired behind the school building. When police arrived, they found a 27-year-old man had been fatally shot in his car in the parking lot. No suspects have been named.
Two men got into an argument during a Flag Football League game at the McKee Stadium. During the argument, one of the men fired a shot into the ground and both fled the scene. No one was injured.

A man threatened to shoot several University of Central Florida students during an altercation at a UCF-area bar near campus. He then followed the students back to UnionWest, a student resident community at the UCF Downtown campus, and fired three shots before fleeing the scene. No one was injured.

A 19-year-old man was shot and injured when a fight between him and an additional person escalated to gunfire. The shooting took place outside of Lindell Library on the university's campus. The suspect fled on foot.

A male student was killed in an unintentional shooting in an on-campus dormitory. The victim's roommate was handling a gun that he believed to be unloaded. He pulled the trigger and fatally shot the victim in the torso.

A high school student was shot and wounded in the school parking lot during the school day. The school was put under lockdown and the student was transported to a nearby hospital. The 17-year-old shooter was charged with aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.

Multiple shots were fired and the bullets struck the school building's physical education building before the school day began. Bullets struck a wall near a locker room, a door frame outside another locker room and a storage room. No injuries were reported.

School name: Alexander W. Dreyfoos School of the Arts
Narrative: A 33-year-old man crashed a van through the main gates of the school while classes were in session. The man then drove through a breezeway and crashed into a palm tree. The man exited the van, was confronted by an SRO and an off-duty police officer, and ran into the auditorium. In the auditorium, the man was shot and killed by the off-duty officer. It is unclear if the man had any weapons on him during the struggle. The victim's friends shared with the media that they believed that mental health played a role in his actions.

A 7-year-old boy was grazed by a bullet and injured when a boy brought his mother's gun to school and it unintentionally discharged in his backpack. The boy found his mother's loaded gun unsecured under her bed and brought it to school. The mother is facing misdemeanor charges.
Shots were fired at the baseball field next to the school building. A group of boys practicing on the field hid in the dugout for cover. No one was injured.
A stray bullet struck one of the school's windows at 1:50 p.m. No students were inside the building at the time and no one was injured. Police believe that the school was not the intended target.

An altercation broke out after a high school graduation on the university's campus in the Murphy Center. The fight spilled over to the campus tennis courts. A 17-year-old boy fatally shot an 18-year-old man and critically injured a 17-year-old boy. The alleged shooter fled the scene and was arrested the next day.

School name: St Louis College of Health Careers
Narrative: A 35-year-old woman, who was a student at the school, was shot and killed by her ex-boyfriend outside of the school. When police arrived to the scene, the ex-boyfriend fired multiple shots at the police before getting in his car and driving away. He drove about 10 minutes away, where he fatally shot himself.

A fight erupted among a group of students on the sidelines of a spring football game. When school staff and a police officer attempted to break up the fight, a shot was fired. No one was injured. A 13-year-old was arrested in relation to the shooting.

A 16-year-old boy and a 40-year-old woman were shot and injured after the graduation ceremony for Crossroads Alternative High School when two people exchanged gun fire from two cars. Police reported that both alleged shooters fled the scene.

An argument broke out after Hammond High School's graduation ceremony at the University Center on the campus of Southeastern Louisiana University and escalated to gunfire. Three bystanders were shot and injured. Police arrested a 20-year-old male suspect who now faces charges of attempted second-degree murder, obstruction of justice, aggravated damage to property and possessing a firearm in a school zone. Police believe that the shooting was gang related and there was more than one shooter.

An 18-year-old man entered the school building and a classroom and fatally shot 21 individuals, including 19 second to fourth-grade students and two adult teachers. The shooter was fatally shot by responding law enforcement. Police report that the shooter shot his grandmother before crashing his truck through a barricade and into a ditch en route to the school. This is the deadliest school shooting in Texas history.

A 17-year-old man was shot in the leg and injured in the elementary school's schoolyard. A 16-year-old boy was arrested the next day and charged with attempted murder, aggravated battery with a firearm, aggravated discharge of a firearm and aggravated unlawful use of a weapon

The high school was placed on lockdown after people reported hearing a "loud bang". Police discovered multiple bullet holes inside a boys restroom and a weapon on campus during the lockdown. A person of interest has been detained.
Three people were shot, one fatally, in the parking lot of Xavier University of Louisiana after a high school graduation ceremony was held there. Multiple people were detained at the scene.
A man was shot and wounded in the parking lot of Helix High School. The shooter fled the scene.
A 31-year-old off-duty deputy was shot and killed while on the campus of Mevers School of Excellence.
A 55-year-old man was shot and wounded when a firearm in his waistband unintentionally discharged on the campus of Duff Elementary School. The man was there to pick up his child from school.
Shots were fired on the campus of Riverside University High School during a fight.
A 21-year-old man was shot and wounded in the parking lot of Southwest Macon High School.

An 18-year-old in a car shot at three juveniles walking through the parking lot of Bloomington High School South. One of the juveniles, a 17-year-old boy, was shot and wounded. Another one of the juveniles, a 15-year-old boy, fired shots back at the vehicle.

School name: Alief ISD Center for Advanced Careers
Narrative: A road rage incident spilled onto the campus of Alief ISD Center for Advanced Careers, where one person was shot and killed and another was shot and injured in the parking lot.
A 17-year-old boy was shot and killed in the parking lot of the Camelot Community Center, a lot adjacent to and owned by Camelot Elementary School.
Shots were fired in an area of the University of Minnesota campus. No one was harmed.
Shots were fired outside of University of Minnesota student housing on campus on Frat Row. A male teenager was shot and injured.

School name: Ulysses S. Grant Senior High School
Narrative: A male 10th grade student was shot in the leg outside of the school during dismissal. The victim was transported to the hospital and was reported to be in stable condition later that night. No suspects have been identified or arrested.

Police received reports that a 32 year-old-man was attempting to break into the elementary school and cars in the parking lot at 9:30 a.m. on a school day. The SRO confronted the man and called for backup. During a confrontation with police, the man reached for the officer's weapon and was fatally shot by an officer.

An individual fired multiple shots in the school parking lot, aimed at the general direction of a football practice, where coaches and student athletes were present. No one was harmed. Police took the suspected shooter into custody and made “several arrests”.

Two groups of minors drove to the school early in the morning. One minor left the car and shot at the other car. No one was harmed, but the car was damaged. A shell casing was found outside of the school. A student was taken into custody. District officials confirmed the student is a student in the district, but did not say if the student attended the school where the incident took place.

A 15-year-old male fired shots into a vehicle in the school's parking lot. The two individuals in the car were unharmed, but the car was damaged. The shooter fled the scene but was found the next day and arrested for unlawful possession of a firearm, disturbing school activity and possession of a dangerous weapon on school property. The suspect was released on $2,500 bail.

A 19-year-old was shot and injured during a fight on school property around 2:30 a.m. The victim was transported to the hospital. Police have also not released any details on possible suspects or motives.

Shots were fired in the stadium parking lot during a Friday night football game. No one was injured. The shots were fired by a 16-year-old, who was apprehended by police along with a 17-year-old and an 18-year-old man. The game was suspended with four minutes left in the third quarter.

A 25-year-old man fired three shots in the school's parking lot while a basketball tournament was taking place inside. No one was injured by the gunfire, but a bullet hit a parked vehicle and a woman sitting in the vehicle was struck by broken glass. The shooter was arrested and charged with nine charges in connection with the shooting, including armed assault to murder and several firearms charges.
A parent fired a shot at another parent when an argument during school dismissal escalated. No one was injured. The school was placed on a temporary lockdown.
Multiple shots were fired outside of the school building. A parked vehicle in the parking lot and the exterior of the school were struck by bullets. No one was injured.
Shots were fired in the school parking lot as a pre-season football scrimmage ended and spectators were leaving. No one was injured.

A 64-year-old male maintenance worker fired multiple shots at an unoccupied, parked vehicle in the parking lot. No one was injured. The suspect was arrested and held on three counts of aggravated assault.

An 18-year-old male student brought two firearms into the school building and one unintentionally discharged when he dropped his backpack. No one was injured. The student was charged with theft by receiving stolen property, carrying a weapon within school safety zone, criminal use of an article with an altered ID, disrupting a public school, and reckless conduct.
Shots were fired on the football field during a Pop Warner football game and injured three spectators in the stand, including one minor. The shooter fled the scene.

School name: Rhodes Academy of Humanties and Arts
Narrative: Shots were fired near the school and broke one of the building's windows. No one was injured.

An 18-year-old man fired multiple shots at the school from his car and broke two windows in the gymnasium. No one was injured. The shooter was arrested and charged on multiple counts, including discharging a gun into a school building.
Shots were fired on a field on the west side of the campus before the school day began. The school went into lockdown and no one was injured. The shooter fled the scene.
A 29-year-old woman, a 17-year-old boy, and a 16-year-old girl were all shot and injured on the school's basketball court overnight. More than 100 shell casings were found around the school.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: An 83-year-old man died by suicide and was found on the field behind the high school. He was discovered by two students.

An officer with the Brownsville ISD opened fire at a car driving recklessly in the school parking lot during drop off. The vehicle was stolen. An 18-year-old man, a 17-year-old boy, and a 16-year-old boy were all arrested and charged with crimes related to the stolen vehicle.

A reportedly 'heated altercation' ended with a student being fatally shot by a student from a different school. The shooting took place during dismissal in the school yard. Police apprehended the suspect and arrested him shortly after the shooting took place.

School name: Louisiana State University and Agricultural & Mechanical College
Narrative: A man was shot and injured in an armed burglary by a 19-year-old man on campus overnight.

A group of students were ejected from the football stadium during a Friday night football game due to fighting. The fight then continued in the career center parking lot. Six rounds were fired during the fight. No one was injured. An 18-year-old man was arrested, as well as a 15-year-old. The 18-year-old was charged with second-degree improper discharge of a firearm and second-degree inducing panic.

Two men were arrested after a call was placed to the police reporting that shots were fired on campus. No one was injured. Both men were found and arrested. One man was charged with reckless endangerment and terrorizing and the second was charged with tampering with evidence.

Shots were fired during a fight in the stadium parking lot after the end of a football game. No one was injured. The accused shooter, a 42-year-old man, fled the scene by car and was later arrested by police. The man was charged with unlawful possession of a firearm, unlawful use of a weapon, resisting arrest, tampering with physical evidence, and misdemeanor unlawful use of a weapon, discharging a firearm into a school.

A 13-year-old student was unintentionally shot in the stomach during the afternoon on school grounds. Police confirmed that the suspect is a 12-year-old student who brought the firearm to the school and has since been arrested. The victim was taken to the hospital.

Four people, including two DSU students, were shot when a non-student began firing into a crowd near the campus basketball courts. Of the two students, one was an 18-year-old female freshman and the other was a 22-year-old male sophomore. No suspect has been identified.

Police were called to Ohio Christian University after a shot was fired into the Ministry and Performing Arts Center front door. When police arrived, a 24-year-old man was holding a gun to his head. No one was injured. The man has been charged with inducing panic, improper handling of a firearm while in a motor vehicle, disruption of public services, and vandalism.

Shots were fired near the Laney High School gymnasium during a football game between Laney High School and Thomson (Ga) High School. Two vehicles were struck by gun fire. No injuries were reported. Two 17-year-olds were detained by investigators, and three firearms were recovered. A third 17-year-old boy was later arrested as well.

Shots were fired as the tailgate for the homecoming football game ended. A 19-year-old and a 14-year-old were struck and injured by bullets. A 19-year-old man was arrested and charged with two counts of aggravated assault, possession of a firearm on school grounds, plus possession of a firearm during the commission of a crime. An 18-year-old man was also arrested and charged with Possession of a Firearm on School Grounds.
A School Resource Officer unintentionally discharged their firearm in the SRO during the school day. No one was injured.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: Mankato High School went into a 'soft lockdown' after a 17-year-old male student attempted suicide by firearm in the parking lot. He later died of his injuries.

Five football players were shot, one fatally, while walking off the football field after a scrimmage. A 14-year-old was fatally shot in the chest. A 17-year-old boy was shot in the arm and leg, a 14-year-old boy was shot once in the thigh, a 15-year-old was shot once in the leg, and a 14-year-old was grazed on the ankle. Investigators say that the five students were ambushed by two alleged shooters, who fired 64 shots at the five students. Police named a 16-year-old male as a person of interest and have an active warrant on charges of murder, attempted murder, theft, obstructing justice, tampering with evidence, and criminal conspiracy.
A student was struck by a bullet from an off campus shooting while standing near the Rivers Residence Halls. A second bullet struck the exterior of a residence hall, but did not injure any person.

School name: McLain High School for Science and Tech
Narrative: Four people were shot, one fatally, at McLain High School's homecoming football game. A 17-year-old boy was fatally shot, a 17-year-old was injured and in critical condition, a 9-year-old girl was shot and injured, and a 20-year-old woman was shot and injured. A warrant was released for a 16-year-old male suspect.

Three people were shot and injured following a football game. A 43-year-old woman was shot in the foot and injured. A 17-year-old girl was shot in the thigh and injured. A 21-year-old man was shot in the ankle and injured. At least five shots were fired.

A security guard unintentionally fired his firearm while retrieving the weapon from a hook in a single stall restroom near the field house where he had hung it. No one was injured. The guard reported the incident to the school and the sheriff's office. The district says they will review their weapons protocol for armed security guards.
Two men exchanged gunfire in an altercation in the courtyard between quad residence halls and then fled the scene. No one was injured. The campus was placed on lockdown.

Three people were shot and injured during the fourth quarter of a football game between Whitmer High School and Central Catholic. Of the victims, one was a Whitmer student, one was an adult male, and one was an adult female. At least 12 shots were fired.
Multiple shots were fired from inside a parked car in the football stadium parking lot. No one was injured. Multiple shell casings were discovered in the parking lot.
A 20-year-old man was shot on campus during an "unsanctioned Homecoming after party", according to the university. The victim was taken to a nearby hospital and is expected to recover.
Four people were shot, one fatally, when an early morning altercation escalated to gunfire at an intersection on the UC Berkeley South Campus. None of the victims were UC Berkeley students.
A father unintentionally discharged a firearm while inside a vehicle in the parking lot during school pick up. The father suffered a non-life threatening injury.
A child brought a firearm to the school and was showing it to other students in the cafeteria when it was unintentionally discharged. No one was injured.
Two people were injured when an altercation during a homecoming concert escalated and multiple shots were fired. Police reported that several others were injured while attempting to flee the scene.

A group of people were gathered outside of Woodruff Library during a homecoming weekend event. A car drove by and fired multiple shots at the group. Four individuals, three of them male students, were injured.

An altercation between three people escalated to gunfire outside of a football game between Bogalusa High School and Jewel Sumner High School. 18 to 20 shots were fired. A 15-year-old was fatally shot, and police believe that the victim was also one of the shooters.

A person was shot and injured in a shooting outside of the stadium following a high school football game. Four individuals were charged with felony possession of a firearm on school property
and felony possession of a stolen firearm in the incident.

A woman was fatally shot during a fight in front of the elementary school during the afternoon. The shooter fled the scene. Police do not believe there was any threat to the school during the incident.
One of the middle school's exterior doors was struck by a round of bullets from a nearby shooting. No one was injured.

A man was fatally shot when a disturbance involving 20 people took place in the school parking lot following a football game. The shooter fled the scene. Police found a firearm and shattered glass in the parking lot.

School name: Central Visual and Performing Arts High School
Narrative: A 19-year-old man opened fire in the school with a long gun. A 61-year-old female teacher and a 15-year-old female student were both fatally shot. Four others suffered gunshot wounds and at least three people received non-gunshot related injuries during the incident. Police located and exchanged gunfire with the shooter, who was pronounced dead at the hospital.
A firearm was unintentionally discharged when a group of students were handling the weapon in a restroom. No one was injured.

A 65-year-old man dropped his gun during a flag football game on school property. When he picked up the gun, he fired a round of shots. No one was injured. The man was charged with prohibited use of a weapon, unlawful carrying of a weapon on school property, reckless endangerment and disorderly conduct.

Police responded to a medical incident in the parking lot of the university's Hearnes Center. A 47-year-old man in the front seat of a parked car was holding a gun. When the police officer asked him to lower the gun, he fired it and died by suicide. The officer also fired a shot, which he says he fired before he realized the man was dead. The officer was placed on administrative leave pending an investigation.

A female police officer was injured when a firearm was unintentionally discharged during an active shooter training session at the elementary school. The training was hosted by a third party provider, who supplied the equipment. The officer was transported to the hospital for treatment.
Two people were injured when a person opened fire on a crowd on the campus of Wiley College early in the morning. Neither of the victims are students.

A 22-year-old man shot and injured a 19-year-old man during an argument between the two men and a female student. The 22-year-old was arrested after a search and charged with assault in the first degree, reckless endangerment in the first degree, evading responsibility, criminal mischief in the first degree, criminal attempt at murder, unlawful discharge of a firearm, and assault with a motor vehicle in the second degree.

A 17-year-old male student fired a gun at a moving car in the parking lot during school dismissal. No one was injured. The student was arrested and charged with aggravated assault, carrying a weapon in a school safety zone, and reckless conduct.

A student was fatally shot in an academic building during the school day. The male shooter fled the scene and was arrested an hour after the shooting on a Metro bus. Police believe that the victim was targeted and there was no threat to the broader school.

An altercation between four individuals, including a 21-year-old male student athlete from New Mexico State University and a 19-year-old male student athlete from the University of New Mexico, escalated to gunfire near student housing on the University of New Mexico campus. The 19-year-old shot the 21-year-old, who returned gunfire. The 19-year-old was pronounced dead on the scene and the 21-year-old was injured and transported to the hospital. A third person involved in the incident, a 17-year-old girl, fled the scene and was later arrested and charged with aggravated battery and conspiracy. The fourth individual, another 19-year-old male, was arrested and charged with aggravated battery, conspiracy to commit a felony, and two counts of tampering with evidence.

Three UVA football players were fatally shot and two were shot and injured when a former player entered the team's bus and open fired. The 22-year-old shooter was arrested and charged with three charges of second-degree murder, three counts of using a handgun in the commission of a felony, and two counts of malicious wounding.
Shots were fired in the school parking lot in the afternoon. Multiple shell casings were discovered. No one was injured.

A 37-year-old woman confronted a woman in the school parking lot and discharged a firearm during the confrontation. She was charged with assault by pointing a gun, felony possession of a firearm on school property, felony discharging a firearm on school property and discharging a firearm in the city limits. No one was injured.

A Sheriff's firearm was unintentionally discharged in a classroom during a law enforcement vocational training. A male student was struck by the bullet and transported to the hospital. The officer was placed on administrative leave pending an investigation into the incident.
A 41-year-old woman was shot and injured in the parking lot following the junior high school football championship. The shooter fled the scene.
Two individuals were shot and wounded in the stadium parking lot following the Friday night football game. One victim was shot in the leg and the second victim sustained a grazed wound.

Two shooters entered the high school and fired more than 30 shots. Six individuals were injured. The victims included two students, one counselor, a security guard, and two others who worked at the school.
An altercation took place in the stadium parking lot during a football game that escalated to gunfire. No one was injured. One parked vehicle was struck by a bullet.
A 15-year-old boy was shot multiple times during a fight on the school's playground. The victim was transported to a nearby hospital.
Two cars began exchanging gunfire while driving down the street and continued shooting in the parking lot of the university's natural sciences building. One person was injured.

A 15-year-old male student was injured when he was unintentionally shot in the leg by a 15-year-old classmate who brought the firearm to school and unintentionally charged it. The shooter was charged with reckless endangerment, reckless endangerment with a deadly weapon, and carrying a weapon on school property.

Five people were shot, one fatally, at an outdoor basketball court on the campus of Florida A&M University. A 21-year-old man was arrested in connection with the incident, and has been charged with one count of murder and four counts of attempted murder.

School name: Benito Juarez Community Academy High School
Narrative: Four students were shot outside on school grounds during school dismissal. A 14-year-old boy and a 15-year-old boy were both fatally shot in the head. A 15-year-old boy's thigh and shoulder were shot and injured. A 15-year-old girl was shot and injured in the thigh. All four teenagers were students at the high school.

Multiple shots were fired outside of the academy. Earlier in the day, a 17-year-old boy brought a loaded firearm to the school was arrested and charged with carrying concealed weapons and conveying a firearm into a school safety zone. Police have not yet determined if these incidents are related.

Multiple shots were fired in the parking lot following a basketball game. No one was injured. The shooter fled the scene. Police found multiple shell casings in the parking lot, as well as damage to parked vehicles.
Shots were fired during a fight in the parking lot that took place after a varsity basketball game. The shooter fled the scene. No one was injured.

A 12-year-old male student removed a gun from his backpack and fired one shot at a window in a classroom full of students. The teacher and an assistant principal were able to obtain the firearm before more shots could be fired. The student was taken into police custody. No one was injured.

A 14-year-old student was shot and injured when an altercation between 10 to 15 students escalated to gunfire. The victim was transferred to the hospital for treatment. A 14-year-old student was arrested in connection to the incident, but was ultimately released. One week later, a sixteen-year-old student identified himself as the shooter and turned himself in to the authorities.
Multiple shots were fired on school grounds following a car chase. During the chase, one of the vehicles crashed a gate of the school campus.
One man was killed in a shooting on the property of the school. School was not in session.

A 16-year-old student was shot at outside of the school. No one was struck or injured. The situation started a few blocks away from the school but ultimately ended up on school property near the front steps.
A 15-year-old fired shots that struck a school building.
6-year-old student shot teacher inside classroom.
A student was shot outside of the school following a basketball game. Police say the shooting stemmed from an attempted robbery.
A student was shot leaving gym during high school basketball game.
A student was shot in the parking lot during a high school basketball game and declined medical attention for the graze.

School name: KIPP Booker T Washington High School
Narrative: A 16-year-old student was shot in the leg outside of school. The shots were fired from a vehicle, putting the school under lockdown.
A 16-year-old student fired a handgun in the bathroom and then fled.
A 32-year-old maintenance worker at the school accidentally fired a 40-caliber Glock after school hours, shooting himself in the foot.
An 18-year-old opened fire at a school basketball game where one person was injured.

School name: Q492 Mathematics, Science Research and Technology Magnet High School
Narrative: A 13-year-old allegedly shot two fellow teens: a 14-year-old  and a 16-year-old during an altercation.
An 18-year-old and a 26-year-old were approached by two men and shot in the parking lot of the school.
A male paraprofessional was outside the back door of the school when a vehicle drove up and opened fire on him, wounding him.
A group of six students had a fight in the parking lot, and one of them produced a gun and fired a shot. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
A 16-year-old student fired a gun in the school parking lot following an altercation. Two students sustained injuries during the incident but they were not shot.
Shots were fired outside the school while a basketball game was going on inside. The result was that two cars were damaged by the gunfire.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: An adult male parent pulled out a handgun during that brief conversation with law enforcement and shot himself in the administration office of the school. No other injuries were reported.

An 18-year-old student was shot following a fight next to the school building. The student walked away from the argument and then was shot in the arm and leg, and airlifted to the hospital. School went on lockdown for 1 hour. Shooter fled.
A 43-year-old gunman killed three people and critically injured five others at Michigan State University before fatally shooting himself.
Shots were fired behind the school building, and the school went on lockdown.

Shots were fired 100 yards from the school. Bullets struck a vehicle in the parking lot. Staff heard shots and put the school on lockdown for 90 minutes while police investigated. Five other vehicles near the school were also struck by bullets.

18-year-old was allegedly armed with a 9mm handgun with an extended ammunition magazine at Starts Right Here. Staff attempted to escort him out of the building when the shooter reportedly started shooting at the teenagers. Both teens were killed, and the staff member was injured.

A 15-year-old student was injured after a firearm accidentally discharged in a vehicle in a Dalhart ISD parking lot. A child not enrolled in the district went to Dalhart High School to pick up three students for lunch and that’s when the gun was discharged.
The windows of two classrooms at a Staten Island elementary school were shot out by an unknown shooter.

Four students were shot outside the school. The shooting happened shortly after the 2:15 p.m. dismissal time for the school day.  Police arrived just over a minute after receiving the alert and found three students inside the school with gunshot wounds.
A student fired a gun inside a classroom during a bathroom break. No one was hurt.

A police officer fired his gun after a suspect pointed a handgun at him at the school. A fight broke out in the parking lot. The police officer fired one shot after a passenger in a car pointed a gun at him.
During an investigation at the school, a police officer accidentally discharged one round into the floor at the school. No one was injured.
A student was hit in the hand by a stray bullet on the tennis courts.
A gunman shot a man off of school grounds and nearly struck three employees who were inside an academic building.
A student baseball player from Olivet College was shot multiple times inside a dugout after a game at Muskingum University.
One student was shot and killed and another was wounded outside of school before morning classes.
A student was shot after two people in a car drove up to the student and opened fire in the parking lot.
A 17-year-old student shot two administrators during a daily search for weapons and fled. The shooter was later found off-campus with a fatal gunshot wound.
An 18-year-old student fired a gun inside their backpack. The bullet struck the ground, then hit another student in the leg.

Intent: Self-harm - no intent to hurt others
Narrative: A staff member died by gun suicide in the parking lot of the school.
A 28-year-old former student shot and killed three 9-year-old students alongside three staff members.
A man was fatally shot and was found on campus in the early hours of the morning.

School name: Barack Obama School of Career and Technical Education
Narrative: A student pointed a gun at another student and fired a round into the air after deboarding the school bus.
A high school senior shot themself in the hand during high school enrollment day at a community college campus.
A child was shot in the school parking lot and taken to the hospital in stable condition.
A man was fatally shot and a 20-year-old woman was injured after a shooting in the parking lot of an elementary school while the school was not in session.
A 20-year-old student was fatally shot while leaving the school’s humanities building.
A school was specifically targeted, with multiple doors and windows of the school shot.
Shots were fired in and around the pickup lane of the school after dismissal.
Two students were shot in the school parking lot during lunch.
The school building was intentionally shot overnight.
A teacher was grazed when a 14-year-old student unintentionally discharged a firearm in a classroom.
A post-prom fight between two students resulted in a shooting by one of their mothers.
A parent shot and critically wounded another parent during pickup at dismissal.
A stray bullet shot a campus monitor outside the school.
A 7th-grade student fired a gun inside a boys' bathroom.
A man unintentionally discharged their gun and shot themselves while leaving a high school graduation, later succumbing to their injury.
A man fired shots at individuals in a car and toward the school, leaving a bullet hole on campus.
A 19-year-old, not affiliated with the school, was shot in the leg in the parking lot after dismissal.
A window was damaged by gunfire following an off-campus shooting incident.
While officers were clearing the school during a swatting hoax, an officer's gun went off while searching a bathroom.
An 18-year-old was shot on an athletic field during morning classes.
Four individuals drove a stolen car on school property and fired shots at the vehicle after crashing the car.
Shots were fired at two vehicles part of a prom convoy in a middle school parking lot.
A 22-year-old was wounded during a shooting on school property.

School name: Conner Creek Academy East Michigan Collegiate High School
Narrative: A 22-year-old fired shots into the air during a fight in front of the school at dismissal.
A 19-year-old opened fire outside a high school graduation ceremony, killing an 18-year-old graduate and their father, as well as wounding 5 others.
An 18-year-old shot and killed a man whose body was found in a car in the school parking lot.
A 26-year-old man was shot four times while sitting on the front steps of the school.
A school custodian was shot by a group of people caught trespassing on school grounds.
A minor was arrested after firing rounds in the school parking lot and toward a nearby person.
A 19-year-old was kidnapped and shot by an ex-partner in front of the school after being confronted by law enforcement.
An altercation between two adult workers on campus escalated, resulting in one adult being shot.
A security guard was shot inside their car by a group of people inside another car in front of the school.
A gunman attempting to enter the school fired shots at a contractor and building before fleeing, later to be shot and injured by police on a residential street.
The school building was hit by several bullets, which was discovered after staff saw students handling a spent casing in the playground.
A shot was fired through the window of the school.
An individual fired shots in the air from the stadium parking lot.
A shooting was reported in the school parking lot during a late-night football scrimmage.
An altercation between two students escalated into a shooting inside the school's cafeteria.

A 15-year-old boy fired shots into a crowd during a large fight that ended a football game early. Multiple responding officers chased the boy. Two officers fired their weapons during the pursuit and the boy sustained a gunshot wound. The gun used by the boy had been reported stolen from a car five days earlier. The boy faces charges of discharging a weapon on school property, possession of a gun on school property, and carrying a concealed firearm.
An 18-year-old student was shot during an attempted robbery in the school parking lot during a football game.
A 16-year-old student was injured by an accidental shooting near the school's pickleball courts.
Shots were fired by an unknown number of individuals at a school football game, leaving 1 student fatally shot and 2 others injured.
Shots were fired during an altercation at a football game.

School name: Dr. Maya Angelou Community High School
Narrative: A school employee was struck by an errant bullet while standing on the field during a football game.
Two students were shot by one another during an altercation outside a residence hall.
A 25-year-old shot and killed a 20-year-old before fatally shooting themselves. The two students were found in a parking lot on campus.

School name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
Narrative: A graduate student fatally shot a faculty member inside a laboratory on campus.
Two pairs of juveniles shot at each other on a school field.
Gunfire broke out during halftime at a high school football game, leaving one 15-year-old student fatally shot and another adult victim wounded.
A 15-year-old boy and a 16-year-old girl were wounded in a random shooting after a high school football game.
Shots were fired near the school's theater area, where a gun was recovered.
Shots were fired in the parking lot outside the school stadium during a football game.
One gunshot was fired inside the men's bathroom.

School name: St. Helena College and Career Academy
Narrative: One student was killed and another two were injured in a shooting during school dismissal.
Two individuals opened fire at a school police officer near the school's football field. The officer returned fire and the individuals fled the area.
A man was shot and injured in the school parking lot.
Two minors fired a gun into the school's cafeteria window.
The school building was struck with bullets in a late-night shooting, causing damage to windows and other areas of the school.
Gunshots were fired during a football game, no injuries were reported.
Gunshots were fired into the air after a football game, no injuries were reported.
The school building was struck by bullets during the school day, damaging multiple windows.
A loaded firearm concealed in a laptop case was unintentionally discharged, injuring a student.
One person was shot and another fatally, after a shooter opened fire in a crowd leaving a high school football game.
Four students and another person were wounded when gunfire erupted outside a crowded homecoming event.
Two young adults were shot and injured during the school's homecoming festivities.
Two campus visitors were shot and injured during an unauthorized party at a campus residence hall.
A student was shot and killed at an apartment complex on campus.
Two students were shot in the school parking lot during a football game.
A 13-year-old shot a firearm outside a high school football game, prompting an evacuation of the stadium.
An adult shot into the air at a stadium during an altercation with a parent at a youth football game.
